description: Dive into "Enchanting Castles of Rome: A Journey Through Time" — a handpicked list of places with quick notes, links, and essentials for fast trip planning and discovery.
title: Enchanting Castles of Rome: A Journey Through Time

places.generalDescription: Castello di Tor Crescenza is a beautiful castle located in the outskirts of Rome. It's perfect for events as the grounds are beautiful and it has a great location. However, the inside of the castle doesn't feel like a castle and it's not as luxurious as some of the other castles in Rome.

sources.snippet: Castello di Torcrescenza is in the countryside, in a large park on the northern outskirts of Roma, surrounded by the Parco di Roma Golf Club. This beautiful home, still inhabited by ...

places.name: Castello di Tor Crescenza

reviews.text: We went there for my friends wedding ceremony. The atmosphere was wonderful. The place located little bit far from Roma city center. Too many different plant grown up in the garden. It was really huge castle. I think it was good idea for wedding ceremony. The food and music was wonderful.
Perfect location where to live a spectacular wedding. Just 15 min by car from North Rome.

This is an incredibly gorgeous castle. With the beautiful and immense park surrounding it, the variety of trees and plants decorating its gardens, the unbelievable beauty of the castle's architecture and its incredible interiors, it's a MUST for those who love castles and history.
It's almost like a piece of Scotland in Rome, a city that offers everything there can be offered.

places.address: Via del Casale della Crescenza, 1, 00189 Roma RM, Italy

places.generalDescription: Located not far from St. Peter's Basilica in Rome, Castel Sant'Angelo is a circular 2nd-century castle that has served various purposes throughout history. Initially built as Emperor Hadrian's mausoleum, it later became a stronghold for the city and was contested by powerful Roman families. In 1367, Pope Urban V received its keys, marking the end of the Avignon exile.

sources.snippet: Built by the Emperor Hadrian in the second century as a mausoleum for himself and his successors, Castel Sant'Angelo is one of the most imposing buildings surviving from antiquity. When threatened by Germanic raiders, Rome was surrounded with a new circuit of walls, and the strategically located mausoleum was incorporated into the defenses, as the strongest fortress in Rome. In 1277, Pope Nicholas III linked the castle with the Vatican Palace by a covered passage known as the passetto.
sources.shortName: 12 Top-Rated Museums and Palaces in Rome

sources.snippet: Facing Sant' Angelo Bridge is Castel Sant'Angelo an enormous circular structure begun by Hadrian as a Mausoleum for himself and his family. In the early middle-ages the tomb was sourrounded with ramparts and became the citadel of Rome. In its general plan, the castle follows the shape of Hadrian's mausoleum, the exact design of which is unknown.

Castel Sant’Angelo, or Castle of the Holy Angel, was changed from a mausoleum into a castle in the year 280. Located on the Tiber River, the Italian castle held a good position for strategic defense against attacks on the Ponte Sant’Angelo bridge.
sources.shortName: 20 Beautiful Italian Castles In Italy To Visit

places.name: Castel Sant'Angelo

reviews.text:
From the outside it doesn't seem much to show, but interior offers much to see and explore. With unique architectural design, decoration, museum of the past, bar and amazing view from the high stories it's definitely worth of visiting. They do offer audible tours if you are interested into deeper history. Just for a quick peek I would suggest like hour-hour and half of your time. However I would consider spending more of your time to properly explore it and enjoy the scene.

Reservation is not required, but in peak season is good to plan ahead

As we are EU citizens and under 25 the tickets were (as in every big sight) very cheap (2€ each). We spent around 1 hour there. Quite interesting to explore the history of the building. In the upper museum part you woll see some reconstructions/models of the past. Very interesting.

Once you get up to the top, the view is amazing. One of the best for that price.

We can really recommend going there and spending around 1-1.5 hours.

May 2025. Cool castle. Minimal line when we got there in the mid-afternoon. Reminded me of Helm's Deep in Lord of the Rings at times. Awesome views throughout as well. It's Rome after all, so it also had a good amount of art and frescoes.

places.generalDescription: Nestled in the charming town of Lunghezza, within the municipality of Rome, Castello di Lunghezza is a captivating historical gem that dates back to the early days of the Roman Republic. Built upon ancient Paleolithic foundations, this castle has witnessed centuries of transformation and has been graced by notable figures such as Jacopone da Todi, Bonifacio VIII, Michelangelo Buonarroti, Caterina De' Medici, and even Carlo of England.

sources.snippet: Amongst the most beautiful Italian castles is Castello Di Lunghezza, a structure built in 752 AD. It began as a monastery for Benedictine monks and was later transformed into a noble residence.
sources.shortName: 20 Beautiful Italian Castles In Italy To Visit

places.name: Castello Di Lunghezza

reviews.text:
My expectations were too high after reading the other reviews when we visited the castello un a Sunday for Halloween. This mail my due to following:
- castello: there is a nice show inside in a big hall but from the castello you don't see really anything
- parking wasn't convenient specifically with two small kids as well more far away. The entrance to the castle is train station therefore go straight to the train station and park there ( straight at the entrance and you avoid 4 euro parking fee)
- I understand it was  beautiful day on the weekend but just too many people, long queues for toilet, lunch areas etc .
- lunch restaurant was only one cashier , waited just for lunch 20min. Prices are ok and big portions
- very unhygienic toilets and specifically not enough. For washing the hands you had to search for the hand washing sink which was hidden behind the toilet . Lot of people therefore didn't wash their hands. Cleaning lady tried to do her best but cleaned just one side of the toilet areas. There was only one (maybe there was another one but couldn't find them) big toilet for small babies where you could change them. Make toilets more adequate for kids and bigger so parents have also space in there . Lot of parents let the kids then urinate below the trees
- Batman: very poor and basically the show was to go to the place of Batman and to take pic with him. Expected a real show like for all the other stuff. Lot of parents were disappointed .
- Audio problems - lots of shows had audio problems and you couldn't hear what they say…
- very negative: lot of people work there but very unorganized . Means for each show you need to be quick there otherwise you risk that your kid doesn't get a place to watch. Kids should stay in front and parents in the back
- overall there had been not enough seating areas and tables , was very difficult to find a place to rest a moment but even for lunch to eat…

In summary very messy and disorganized overall. I thought to give more points for the workers as they are friendly and tried to do the best but the person who organizes this place should go himself with kids in order to understand what is wrong there if he doesn't see it himself. Some shows are nice and some others are mainly poor due to the setup .

Happy kids means happy parents.

The same is also for : happy parents means happy kids as they are relaxed, intend to stay more , spend more money , etc

places.address: Via della Tenuta del Cavaliere, 230, 00132 Roma RM, Italy

places.generalDescription: The Castello di Giulio II, built in 1486, is a massive papal fortress featuring rounded walls and towers. It serves as a museum of ceramics and stands as a symbol of Renaissance military architecture. The structure's perimeter system connects the main tower to two other towers, with residential environments added during the pontificate of Giulio II. Visitors can enjoy lovely views of the medieval village Borgo di Gregoriopoli and Ostia Antica from the castle.

sources.snippet: Named after Pope Giulio II, this castle features Renaissance military architecture. Built to guard the mouth of the Tiber River, Castello DI Guilio II is an example of the breathtaking history of Italian castles.
sources.shortName: 20 Beautiful Italian Castles In Italy To Visit

places.name: Castello di Giulio II

reviews.text: We had a few hours to kill before our flight, and this was the perfect place to enjoy the afternoon.

Worth the cost of admission. The views and history are extensive. Only wish the plaques were in more languages than Italian, oh well.
Well maintained and friendly staff!

The castle itself is absolutely stunning and definitely worth a visit - the history, the architecture, and the atmosphere are amazing. Unfortunately, my experience was ruined because I was robbed in the parking area across from the castle. This left a really bitter impression, and I can't recommend the visit without warning others to be extremely careful with their belongings. Beautiful place, but sadly overshadowed by the lack of safety around it.

places.address: Piazza della Rocca, 13, 00119 Ostia Antica RM, Italy
